Love,Minor,Yourself: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.
And thou shalt have goats' milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.
The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.
Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.
Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.
Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.
Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.
The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.
Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.
Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.
It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.
Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.
Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
The wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
The wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the grey head.
Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.
That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:
And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.
It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:
Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.
By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.
In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
Hell and destruction are before the LORD: how much more then the hearts of the children of men?
A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.
A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:
For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.
A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.
Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.
A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.
But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.
Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.
An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.
A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.
Many seek the ruler's favour; but every man's judgment cometh from the LORD.
He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.
And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.
Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.
Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
The king's favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.
Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.
The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.
The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:
For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.
Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.
The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.
She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.
Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
Life-changing,Love,Yourself: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
She is like the merchants' ships; she bringeth her food from afar.
When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.
As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
The rich man's wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.
He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.
He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.
Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.
He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.
A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.
A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.
Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.
My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.
I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.
The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.
The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.
Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.
Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.
As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.
Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.
There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:
The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.
Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.
By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.
Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.
A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.
When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.
Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
It is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:
Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.
When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.
Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.
Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.
Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.
For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety.
For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.
He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.
The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:
That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.
For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:
So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place:
For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.
Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:
For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.
The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.
Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.
Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.
A GOOD name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?
The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.
Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?
The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.
The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.
Another,Love,Minor: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.
A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.
Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.
She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.
A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool's wrath is heavier than them both.
He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.
The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.
The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.
As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
A man's heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.
The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked: but God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.
The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.
For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.
A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.
He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.
The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.
As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.
A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.
A fool despiseth his father's instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.
A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.
A fool's mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate.
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.
As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.
He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.
It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:
She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.
Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.
A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth: and the recompence of a man's hands shall be rendered unto him.
House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.
He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,
Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.
Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
A man's belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.
The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.
Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly are his delight.
Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.
It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.
As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.
The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.
But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.
The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD, as the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.
A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.
The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.
I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.
Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.
A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.
The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.
When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.
As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?
Open rebuke is better than secret love.
Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
In the multitude of people is the king's honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
Another,Life-changing,Love: It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.
Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.
Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.
A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.
A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.
He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?
A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.
The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.
Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.
He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.
He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.
The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.
Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: and he that hateth reproof shall die.
Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.
She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
There are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.
For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.
The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.
For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:
But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.
He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
A wise son heareth his father's instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.
The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.
If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.

The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.
He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.
Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.
An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.
Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.
Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.
A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the upright, he directeth his way.
The LORD hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.
There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.
Divers weights are an abomination unto the LORD; and a false balance is not good.
The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
Another,Life-changing,Money: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
The rich man's wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.
The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.
She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.
He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;
When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.
Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:
While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.
When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.
He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.
A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.
She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.
The words of a man's mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.
They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.
The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.
Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.
As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.
The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.
She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.
I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.
He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
For I was my father's son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.
The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: and a good report maketh the bones fat.
She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.
The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.
The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.
Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.
She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.
The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
An high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.
He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
Happy is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.
Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but safety is of the LORD.
The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.
The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
The LORD is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
A man's pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.
He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;
Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.
In the light of the king's countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.
The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.
Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.
The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.
A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.
Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.
Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.
There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.
A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
